com.facebook.react

Class ReactInstanceManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.facebook.react.ReactInstanceManager

  • public class ReactInstanceManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is managing instances of CatalystInstance. It exposes a way to configure catalyst instance using ReactPackage and keeps track of the lifecycle of that instance. It also sets up connection between the instance and developers support functionality of the framework. An instance of this manager is required to start JS application in ReactRootView (see ReactRootView.startReactApplication(com.facebook.react.ReactInstanceManager, java.lang.String) for more info). The lifecycle of the instance of ReactInstanceManager should be bound to the activity that owns the ReactRootView that is used to render react application using this instance manager (see ReactRootView.startReactApplication(com.facebook.react.ReactInstanceManager, java.lang.String)). It's required to pass owning activity's lifecycle events to the instance manager (see onHostPause(), onHostDestroy() and onHostResume(android.app.Activity, com.facebook.react.modules.core.DefaultHardwareBackBtnHandler)). To instantiate an instance of this class use builder().

    • Method Detail

      • builder

        public static ReactInstanceManagerBuilder builder()
        Creates a builder that is capable of creating an instance of ReactInstanceManager.

      • getDevSupportManager

        public DevSupportManager getDevSupportManager()

      • getMemoryPressureRouter

        public MemoryPressureRouter getMemoryPressureRouter()

      • createReactContextInBackground

        public void createReactContextInBackground()
        Trigger react context initialization asynchronously in a background async task. This enables applications to pre-load the application JS, and execute global code before ReactRootView is available and measured. This should only be called the first time the application is set up, which is enforced to keep developers from accidentally creating their application multiple times without realizing it. Called from UI thread.

      • registerAdditionalPackages

        public void registerAdditionalPackages(java.util.List<ReactPackage> packages)

      • registerInitFunction

        public void registerInitFunction(java.lang.String module,
                                 java.lang.String method,
                                 @Nullable
                                 NativeArray arguments)
        If the JavaScript bundle for this app requires initialization as part of bridge start up, register a function using its @param module and @param method and optional arguments.

      • recreateReactContextInBackground

        public void recreateReactContextInBackground()
        Recreate the react application and context. This should be called if configuration has changed or the developer has requested the app to be reloaded. It should only be called after an initial call to createReactContextInBackground.

        Called from UI thread.

      • hasStartedCreatingInitialContext

        public boolean hasStartedCreatingInitialContext()
        Returns:
        whether createReactContextInBackground has been called. Will return false after onDestroy until a new initial context has been created.

      • onBackPressed

        public void onBackPressed()
        This method will give JS the opportunity to consume the back button event. If JS does not consume the event, mDefaultBackButtonImpl will be invoked at the end of the round trip to JS.

      • onNewIntent

        public void onNewIntent(android.content.Intent intent)
        This method will give JS the opportunity to receive intents via Linking.

      • onHostPause

        public void onHostPause()
        Deprecated. Use onHostPause(Activity) instead.
        Call this from Activity.onPause(). This notifies any listening modules so they can do any necessary cleanup.

      • onHostPause

        public void onHostPause(android.app.Activity activity)
        Call this from Activity.onPause(). This notifies any listening modules so they can do any necessary cleanup. The passed Activity is the current Activity being paused. This will always be the foreground activity that would be returned by ReactContext.getCurrentActivity().
        Parameters:
        activity - the activity being paused

      • onHostResume

        public void onHostResume(android.app.Activity activity,
                         DefaultHardwareBackBtnHandler defaultBackButtonImpl)
        Use this method when the activity resumes to enable invoking the back button directly from JS. This method retains an instance to provided mDefaultBackButtonImpl. Thus it's important to pass from the activity instance that owns this particular instance of ReactInstanceManager, so that once this instance receive onHostDestroy() event it will clear the reference to that defaultBackButtonImpl.
        Parameters:
        defaultBackButtonImpl - a DefaultHardwareBackBtnHandler from an Activity that owns this instance of ReactInstanceManager.

      • onHostDestroy

        public void onHostDestroy()
        Deprecated. use onHostDestroy(Activity) instead
        Call this from Activity.onDestroy(). This notifies any listening modules so they can do any necessary cleanup.

      • onHostDestroy

        public void onHostDestroy(android.app.Activity activity)
        Call this from Activity.onDestroy(). This notifies any listening modules so they can do any necessary cleanup. If the activity being destroyed is not the current activity, no modules are notified.
        Parameters:
        activity - the activity being destroyed

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Destroy this React instance and the attached JS context.

      • showDevOptionsDialog

        public void showDevOptionsDialog()

      • attachRootView

        public void attachRootView(ReactRootView rootView)
        Attach given to a catalyst instance manager and start JS application using JS module provided by ReactRootView.getJSModuleName(). If the react context is currently being (re)-created, or if react context has not been created yet, the JS application associated with the provided root view will be started asynchronously, i.e this method won't block. This view will then be tracked by this manager and in case of catalyst instance restart it will be re-attached.

      • detachRootView

        public void detachRootView(ReactRootView rootView)
        Detach given from current catalyst instance. It's safe to call this method multiple times on the same - in that case view will be detached with the first call.

      • createAllViewManagers

        public java.util.List<ViewManager> createAllViewManagers(ReactApplicationContext catalystApplicationContext)
        Uses configured ReactPackage instances to create all view managers.
